Post.title: Hexo
Post._content: ## ### NexT _config.yml ``` busuanzi_count: # count values only if the other configs are false enable: true # custom uv span for the whole site site_uv: true site_uv_header: site_uv_footer: # custom pv span for the whole site site_pv: true site_pv_header: site_pv_footer: # custom pv span for one page only page_pv: true page_pv_header: page_pv_footer: ``` wordcountmin2read ``` # Post wordcount display settings # Dependencies: https://github.com/willin/hexo-wordcount post_wordcount: item_text: true wordcount: true # min2read: true # totalcount: false # separated_meta: true ``` hexo-wordcount Hexo ``` hexo --debug `` ### hexo-wordcount ``` npm i --save hexo-wordcount ``` *** Node 7.6.0 , 2.x (Node.js v7.6.0 and previous) *** ``` npm install hexo-wordcount@2 --save ``` ### `post.swig``xxx_blog/themes/next/layout/_macro/post.swig` ![](/img/view_count.png)
Post.raw: --- title: Hexo date: 2017-04-19 19:21:01 tags: [hexo,next] categories: --- ## ### NexT _config.yml ``` busuanzi_count: # count values only if the other configs are false enable: true # custom uv span for the whole site site_uv: true site_uv_header: site_uv_footer: # custom pv span for the whole site site_pv: true site_pv_header: site_pv_footer: # custom pv span for one page only page_pv: true page_pv_header: page_pv_footer: ``` wordcountmin2read ``` # Post wordcount display settings # Dependencies: https://github.com/willin/hexo-wordcount post_wordcount: item_text: true wordcount: true # min2read: true # totalcount: false # separated_meta: true ``` hexo-wordcount Hexo ``` hexo --debug `` ### hexo-wordcount ``` npm i --save hexo-wordcount ``` *** Node 7.6.0 , 2.x (Node.js v7.6.0 and previous) *** ``` npm install hexo-wordcount@2 --save ``` ### `post.swig``xxx_blog/themes/next/layout/_macro/post.swig` ![](/img/view_count.png)

!function(e,t,a){function n(){c(".heart{width: 10px;height: 10px;position: fixed;background: #f00;transform: rotate(45deg);-webkit-transform: rotate(45deg);-moz-transform: rotate(45deg);}.heart:after,.heart:before{content: '';width: inherit;height: inherit;background: inherit;border-radius: 50%;-webkit-border-radius: 50%;-moz-border-radius: 50%;position: fixed;}.heart:after{top: -5px;}.heart:before{left: -5px;}"),o(),r()}function r(){for(var e=0;e<d.length;e++)d[e].alpha<=0?(t.body.removeChild(d[e].el),d.splice(e,1)):(d[e].y--,d[e].scale+=.004,d[e].alpha-=.013,d[e].el.style.cssText="left:"+d[e].x+"px;top:"+d[e].y+"px;opacity:"+d[e].alpha+";transform:scale("+d[e].scale+","+d[e].scale+") rotate(45deg);background:"+d[e].color+";z-index:99999");requestAnimationFrame(r)}function o(){var t="function"==typeof e.onclick&&e.onclick;e.onclick=function(e){t&&t(),i(e)}}function i(e){var a=t.createElement("div");a.className="heart",d.push({el:a,x:e.clientX-5,y:e.clientY-5,scale:1,alpha:1,color:s()}),t.body.appendChild(a)}function c(e){var a=t.createElement("style");a.type="text/css";try{a.appendChild(t.createTextNode(e))}catch(t){a.styleSheet.cssText=e}t.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(a)}function s(){return"rgb("+~~(255*Math.random())+","+~~(255*Math.random())+","+~~(255*Math.random())+")"}var d=[];e.requestAnimationFrame=function(){return e.requestAnimationFrame||e.webkitRequestAnimationFrame||e.mozRequestAnimationFrame||e.oRequestAnimationFrame||e.msRequestAnimationFrame||function(e){setTimeout(e,1e3/60)}}(),n()}(window,document);

Post.title: composerPHP
Post._content:
>
Framework Interoperability Group FIG 2009 FIG  PHP  PSR-0  PSR-4  PHP 

~~~
* PSR-0 (Autoloading Standard) 

* PSR-1 (Basic Coding Standard) 

* PSR-2 (Coding Style Guide) 

* PSR-3 (Logger Interface) 

* PSR-4 (Improved Autoloading) 
~~~

### composer.json
 `my-framework` My First Framework based on Composer `composer.json` 
~~~
{
	"require":{
		
	}
}
~~~
### composer
cmd `my_framework`
~~~
composer update
~~~
` vendor`
<center>
![](/img/composer-2-1.png)
</center>

<center>
![](/img/composer-2-2.png)
</center>

composer

Post.title: Hexo NexT
Post._content:
Hexo,

### 
(DaoVoice)[http://www.daovoice.io/]
:
DaoVoice,app_idappid:
![](/img/daovoice.png)

next,/themes/next/layout/_partials/head.swig
```
{% if theme.daovoice %}
  <script>
  (function(i,s,o,g,r,a,m){i["DaoVoiceObject"]=r;i[r]=i[r]||function(){(i[r].q=i[r].q||[]).push(arguments)},i[r].l=1*new Date();a=s.createElement(o),m=s.getElementsByTagName(o)[0];a.async=1;a.src=g;a.charset="utf-8";m.parentNode.insertBefore(a,m)})(window,document,"script",('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https:' : 'http:') + "//widget.daovoice.io/widget/0f81ff2f.js","daovoice")
  daovoice('init', {
      app_id: "{{theme.daovoice_app_id}}"
    });
  daovoice('update');
  </script>
{% endif %}
```
_config.yml
```
# Online contact 
daovoice: true
daovoice_app_id: app_id
```
,next:
![](/img/chat.png)
,:
![](/img/wechat.png)

****

*Windows*



> 1Windowshexo**nodejs****git**
> 2nodejsgithexo
> 3github.comrepositoryyourusername.github.io
> 4hexogithub 5yourusername.github.io

### nodejs
nodejs[nodejs-](http://www.runoob.com/nodejs/nodejs-install-setup.html)

[nodejs](https://nodejs.org/en/download/)Windows64bitwindow-install64-bit32bit32-bit
nextfinish
![](/img/install-node-msi-version-on-windows-step5.png)
PATHNode.js=="cmd" => "path"nodejsnodejs
~~~
PATH=C:\oraclexe\app\oracle\product\10.2.0\server\bin;C:\Windows\system32;
C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\;
c:\python32\python;C:\MinGW\bin;C:\Program Files\GTK2-Runtime\lib;
C:\Program Files\MySQL\MySQL Server 5.5\bin;C:\Program Files\nodejs\;
~~~
Node.js node --version
![](/img/node-version.png)
oknodejs

Post.title: git
Post._content:
* gitcommit

### 
1hexo
```
	git branch hexo
```
2
```
	git branch -a
	  * master
		hexo
```
3hexocommit
```
	git checkout hexo

	echo 'hexo' > test.txt

	git add .
	git commit -m 'add test.txt'
```
4
```
	git branch -D hexo
```
5hexo
```
	git branch -a
	  * master
```

## 
1git log -g commit
```
commit 3eac14d05bc1264cda54a7c21f04c3892f32406a
Reflog: HEAD@{1} (fdipzone <fdipzone@sina.com>)
Reflog message: commit: add test.txt
Author: fdipzone <fdipzone@sina.com>
Date:   Sun Jan 31 22:26:33 2016 +0800

    add test.txt

```
2 git branch recover_branch[] commit_id commit
```
git branch recover_branch_hexo 3eac14d05bc1264cda54a7c21f04c3892f32406a

git branch -a
* master
  recover_branch_hexo
```
 recover_branch_hexo
3recover_branch_hexo
```
git checkout recover_branch_hexo
ls -lt
```
Post.raw:
---
title: git 
date: 2018-03-28 18:21:01
tags: GIT
categories: GIT
---
* gitcommit

### 
1hexo
```
	git branch hexo
```
2

Post.title: PHPdesign patterns of PHP
Post._content:
### 23  

> java25
> creational patternsstructural patternsbehavioral patterns  

### **creational patterns:**  
>1.  -- factory pattern  
>2.  -- abstract factory pattern  
>3.  -- singleton pattern  
>4.  -- builder pattern  
>5.  -- prototype pattern  

### **structural patterns:**  
>1.   --  adapter pattern
>2.     --  bridge pattern
>3. /  --  filter pattern / criteria pattern
>4.     --  composite pattern
>5.   --  decorator pattern
>6. /  --  facade pattern
>7.     --  flyweight pattern
>8.     --  proxy pattern

### **behavioral patterns**  
>1.   --  responsibility pattern
>2.     --  command pattern
>3.   --  expression pattern
>4.   --  iterator pattern
>5.   -- mediator pattern
>6.   --  memento pattern
>7.   --  observer pattern
>8.     --  state pattern
>9.   --  null object pattern
>10.    --  strategy pattern
>11.    --  template pattern
>12.  --  visitor pattern

> >jquery ### ``` layer.open({ type: 2, title: 'title', area: ['500px', '350px'], content 'son.html' }) var img_url; parent.$("input[name='img']").val(img_url); parent.$('#img').attr('src', img_url); parent.layer.closeAll(); ``` ## jQuery ```

  • one

    • one_first
    • two_first
``` ### jquery #### parent() ``` $("#one").parent().parent(); // idfirstlili $("#one").parent().parent('.par'); // classparul $("#one").parent('.par'); // idoneclassparul ``` #### parents()closest() >1. closest01 >2. parents01 ``` $("#one").parnets('.par'); // classpar/ $("one").closest('.par'); // classparul ``` ### jquery #### parentfind ``` $('.title').parent().find('ul'); // classtitleulclassparul ``` #### sibingls() ``` $('.title').sibings('ul'); // classtitleulclassparul ``` ### jquery #### :first ``` $('.par:first-child'); // idfirstlili ``` #### ``` $('#firstli h3.title'); // classtitleh3 ``` #### find() ``` $('#firstli').find('h3'); // classtitleh3 ``` #### children() ``` $('#firstli').children('h3.title'); // classtitleh3 ```

Post.title: MYSQL
Post._content:
```
create table if not exists test(
	id int(11) not null auto_increment primary key,
	num int(11) null
)
```
### 
>(+)(-)(*)(/)(%)(div)(mod)

```
select id, num, id+num, id-num, id*num, id/num, id%num, id div num, id mod num from test;

id 	num 	id+num 	id-num 	id*num 	id/num 	id%num 	id div num 	id mod num
5  	2   	8	  	3      	10     	2.5    	1      	2			1
6   null	null	null	null	null	null	null		null
null 5		null	null	null	null	null	null		null
```

### 
>(>)(<)(=)(!=<>)(>=)(<=)

```
1. 1
2. 0
3. NULLnull
```  

>null(IS NULL)null(IS NOT NULL)

```
 <=> a<=>0010a<=>nullnull10
```  

>(between a and b)  
>(id IN (1,2,3))(id not in(1,2,3))  
>(name like '%keyword%')(name not like '%keyword%')  

```
1. like 'abc'  =abc
2. like '%abc' abc
3. like 'abc%' abc
4. like '%abc%'abc

```

>(a regexp '^a')

```
1. a regexp '^abc' abc
2. a regexp 'abc'  abc
3. a regexp 'abc$' abc
```

### 
>(&&AND)(||OR)(!NOT)(XOR)

```
1. &&  00null0nullnull01
2. ||  000nullnull0null1
3. !   nullnull010null1
4. XOR nullnull000001
```

### 
>(&)(|)(~)(^)(<<)(>>)

```
1. &	
	10&5 => 1010&0101 => 0000 => 0
	10&6 => 1010&0110 => 0010 => 2
2. |	
	10&5 => 1010|0101 => 1111 => 15
	10&6 => 1010|0110 => 1110 => 14
3. ~	
	10 => 1010 => 0101 => 18446744073709551605()
4. ^	
	10&5 => 1010^0101 => 1111 => 15
	10&6 => 1010^0110 => 1100 => 12
5. <<	m << n mnn0
	10 << 1 => 1010 => 10100 => 20
5. >>	m >> n mnn0
	10 >> 1 => 1010 => 0101 => 5
```

### 
![image](https://wenku.baidu.com/content/216d3e2926284b73f242336c1eb91a37f11132c9?m=26e2fd787393eaa2973d6c1f478627b5&type=pic&src=04452f9619b2848d6d760be569e87603.jpg)

Post.title: MYSQL
Post._content:
>  `table_test` 

### 
```
create table if not exists table_test(
    id int(11) auto_increment primary key,
    name varchar(30) not null comment '',
    password varchar(30) not null comment ''
) comment="";
```

### 
```
show columns from table_test;

describe table_test;

desc table_test;
```

### 
#### 1. 
```
alter table table_test
    add sex enum('male', 'female') not null default 'male' comment '',
    modify name varchar(40);
```
#### 2. 
```
alter table table_test
    change column date create_time date null default '0000-00-00';
```
#### 3. 
```
alter table table_test 
    drop create_time;
```
#### 4. 
```
alter table table_test 
    rename as table_test_new;
```

### 
```
rename table table_test_new to table_test;
```

### 
#### 1. 
```
create table table_test_copy1 like table_test;
```
#### 2. 
```
create table table_test_copy2 as select * from table_test;
```
#### 3. 
>`id`,`name`
```
create table table_test_copy3 as select id,name from table_test'
```

### 
```
drop table if not exists table_test;
```

```
#### 2. 
```
create table table_test_copy2 as select * from table_test;
```
#### 3. 
>`id`,`name`
```
create table table_test_copy3 as select id,name from table_test'
```

### 
```
drop table if not exists table_test;
```

Post.title: linux
Post._content:
### 

>

```
netstat:
    -t : TCP
    -u : UDP
    -l : ((protocol))
    -p : /
    -n : DNSIP()
netstat -ntlp   //tcp
netstat -ntulp |grep 80   //80
netstat -an | grep 3306   //3306
```

### 

>
>PC_A eth0: 172.18.10.212  eth1: 219.239.xx.xx  
>
>PC_B 172.18.10.205  
>
>A8080B80

#### 1. 
```
/etc/sysctl.conf:
    net.ipv4.ip_forward = 1 0.
iptalbes FORWARD
```
#### 2. /etc/rc.d/init.diptables 
```
Usage: ./iptables {start|stop|restart|condrestart|status|panic|save}
    service iptables {....}
    iptables 
    
/etc/rc.d/init.d
    ./iptables stop
    iptalbes -F
    iptalbes -X
    iptalbes -Z
    ./iptables save
```
#### 3. 
```
iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -d 219.239.xx.xx -p tcp --dport 8080 -j DNAT --to-destination 172.18.10.205:80

iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -d 172.18.10.205 -p tcp --dport 80 -j SNAT --to 172.18.10.212

iptables -A FORWARD -o eth0 -d 172.18.10.205 -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT

iptables -A FORWARD -i eth0 -s 172.18.10.205 -p tcp --sport 80 -j ACCEPT

DNAT SNAT 
```
#### 4. 
```
 ./iptables save

/etc/sysconfig/iptables

```
#### 5. iptables 
```
 ./iptables start
 /proc/net/ip_conntrack

    tcp 6 53 TIME_WAIT src=221.122.59.2 dst=219.239.xx.xx sport=7958 dport=8080 packets=9 bytes=1753
    
    src=172.18.10.205 dst=172.18.10.212 sport=80 dport=7958 packets=9 bytes=5777 [ASSURED] use=1
```

githubclonegit bash
1cd ~/.ssh ssh key
<center>
![](/img/ssh_dir.png)
</center>
2ssh keygithub
```
ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "youremail@youremail.com"

Creates a new ssh key using the provided email # Generating public/private rsa key pair.

Enter file in which to save the key (/home/you/.ssh/id_rsa):
```
Enter()
```
Enter same passphrase again: [Type passphrase again]
```

```
Your public key has been saved in /home/you/.ssh/id_rsa.pub.
The key fingerprint is: # 01:0f:f4:3b:ca:85:d6:17:a1:7d:f0:68:9d:f0:a2:db your_email@youremail.com
```
<center>
![](/img/ssh_gen.png)
</center>
3id_rsa.pubsshpwd
<center>
![](/img/ssh_pwd.png)
</center>
<center>
![](/img/ssh_key_dir.png)
</center>
4githubsetting SSH and GPG keys
<center>
![](/img/github_ssh.png)
</center>
 new ssh keyssh keytitle
add key
ssh
5ssh
```
ssh -T git@github.com
```

```
Hi xxx! You've successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not # provide shell access.
```
6ssh
```
git remote -v
origin https://github.com/zhipenwang/zhipenwang.git (fetch)
origin https://github.com/zhipenwang/zhipenwang.git (push)
```
httpsssh
```
git remote set-url origin git@github.com:zhipenwang/zhipenwang.git
```
push
